summary:
I am a reliable and passionate researcher with 5 years of experience in academic laboratories. I like to work in a team and experienced that I get energised by supervising students and by managing multidisciplinary projects. Moreover, I like to use my perseverance and analytical skills to solve complex problems: both in chemistry research as well as on the chess board. 

In my PhD, I used liposomes as a scaffold to incorporate light-activatable photosensitisers and catalysts within the lipid membrane and study their potential to produce solar fuels (CO2 conversion, hydrogen production) after light irradiation. I also study related (photo)electron transfer processes, such as transmembrane electron transfer, which is key in natural photosynthesis. Besides my interest into photocatalysis, I also utilise liposomes as nanocarriers for (anti-cancer) drugs for drug delivery purposes.
